Header: Commander Lauds Service of Two Retiring Majors General
Content: Major General Dushyantha Rajaguru and Major General Chandana Gunawardana on the eve of their retirement from the Army upon completion of more than three decades of unblemished and dedicated service were hailed by the Commander of the Army, Lieutenant General Shavendra Silva when he invited both of them to his office at the Army Headquarters this afternoon (17). Lieutenant General Shavendra Silva during his meeting with both those retiring Senior Officers gratefully and warmly acknowledged the exemplary contribution they have made towards the growth of the Army and recalled several unforgettable memories that the Commander had shared with those retiring Majors General. Extending best wishes for their future endeavours, the Commander emphatically wished them good luck in their retirement and awarded both of them with special mementoes as symbols of appreciation and commendation. Major General Dushyantha Rajaguru of the Sri Lanka Sinha Regiment served as the Commander, Security Forces - Mullaittivu for more than 2 years until he left the office on Saturday (14). Prior to it, Major General Rajaguru served a number of key appointments in the organization. Major General Chandana Gunawardana at the time of his retirement was serving as the Commandant at Buttala Officer Career Development Centre (OCDC). He was also the Colonel of the Regiment, Vijayabahu Infantry Regiment. He also served a number of prestigious appointments during his career.
